description: Known for their striking green plumage and a distinct yellow patch on the nape of the neck, which grows with age. They have a robust build and a powerful beak.
temperament: Highly intelligent, outgoing, and often comical. They can be prone to hormonal aggression ('bluffing') during adolescence and breeding season.
loudness: Very Loud. They have powerful voices and are known for their enthusiastic screaming sessions, especially in the morning and evening.
vocalization: Exceptional talkers and singers. Many can develop extensive vocabularies and learn full songs.
dietaryNeeds: Prone to obesity. Requires a diet low in fat, based on high-quality pellets, with a large variety of fresh vegetables and limited fruit and nuts.
healthPointers: Long-lived (50-80+ years) and require experienced handling. Vulnerable to obesity, fatty liver disease, and Vitamin A deficiency. Regular exercise is essential.
housing: Needs a large space. A cage no smaller than 36"W x 24"D x 48"H is needed, but bigger is better. Unsuitable for apartments due to high noise levels.
